subject: Re: [junit] JUnit 4 with bea 9.2 workshop
msgSnippet: ... Me, I d personally leave @Before/AfterClass as they are and instead figure out a neat way of defining a set of global @BeforeTestRun and @AfterTestRun
messageBody:
> Cédric Beust ♔ wrote:
> > There are indeed several ways to achieve this with JUnit, but why not simply
> > add @BeforeSuite and @AfterSuite? The intent would be much clearer,
> > wouldn't it?
> >
On 8/11/06, David Saff <saff@...> wrote:
> Maybe. What do people think?

Me, I'd personally leave @Before/AfterClass as they are and instead
figure out a neat way of defining a set of "global" @BeforeTestRun and
@AfterTestRun methods that are run before/after the whole collection
of tests whether they're test classes or suites.

Wouldn't flag it as high priority, though.

-Lasse-
